duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist in the oversight and maintenance of the organization's IT systems and infrastructure, including servers, networks, and applications.
Create and update internal technical documentation for IT processes, procedures, and policies.
Maintain accurate records and documentation for regulatory entities and auditors to ensure legal and compliance requirements are met.

Manage enterprise systems and applications including but not limited to Windows Server, SQL, Exchange, VMware, Office 365, Hybrid Identities, Mimecast, Active Directory, Encryption, Information Protection, Veeam, and Fortinet.
Support ERP & other core business system users and security controls per documented procedures to maintain regulatory compliance.
Provide escalation support for lower-level IT staff.
Coordinating, tracking, reviewing and ensuring timely completion of high-quality controlled documents such as process flows, procedures, reports, forms, specifications, protocols, etc.
Work closely with the IT team to ensure all documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and aligned with industry best practices.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
